name: places/ChIJBRgSlrdZwokRNEuIs2-wphQ
adrFormatAddress: 429 11th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text: This is THE annual American Art show where art studios and galleries throughout the country show, trade and promote their collection and artists. In 2023 it is running at Javits Center instead of the smaller but traditional Armory location in the show name. It was a public show for Sat. and Sun. only with a pretty large and trendy crowd. The entrance fee is on the pricey side but you can order online to save a little or in-person if you have NYC residence. You have to put e-tickets in your Google Wallet with NFC on. There are paintings, sculptures, multimedia art mostly from contemporary and young artists and some unorthodox exhibits to challenge your art appreciation. Many attendees also dress up in artistic clothing. There are alcoholic beverages and cocktails served along with some snacks for purchase.

originalText.text: The New York’s international art exhibition began in 1994 as ‘Gramercy International Art Fair’. It’s renamed as ‘The Armory Show’ in 1999. Their motto is’The New Spirit’. It became the largest art fair in New York City. A place to see what’s trending in modern art and art works of established artists.

text.text: The New York’s international art exhibition began in 1994 as ‘Gramercy International Art Fair’. It’s renamed as ‘The Armory Show’ in 1999. Their motto is’The New Spirit’. It became the largest art fair in New York City. A place to see what’s trending in modern art and art works of established artists.

originalText.text:
Again this year there MIGHT BE 10 pieces of art I’d hand on my wall and maybe 3 artists that I noticed I’d represent. Very discouraging. I was watching peoples faces as I walked the show. Even had a conversation with a gentleman who agreed. Maybe we’re all missing something. I think I have pretty good taste in art…. But who knows after this show. If my VIP tickets weren’t free I’d feel cheated.
The show organizers have done a great job laying out the displays so you can walk and see everything.
The Javit Center was clean and organized as usual.

originalText.text: I'd rate the New York Armory Show 4/5. It's a great way to stay updated on art trends. While I'm not a fan of the move to the Javitz Center, its proximity to Hudson Yards is a plus. This year had a good layout, and I'm excited to return next time. Definitely make sure you give yourself enough time to really explore all the art!

originalText.text:
was an amazing experience as an art student. I saw so much art that I loved and got a sense of what is valued in the art scene today.

I didn't expect to see to many paintings there but I was not dissapointed! painting is making a comeback!!

I would 100% reccomend going if you have the opportunity to go. it's hard to see everything, but if you plan it out before hand, it's possible!
